channel.title: [US] Bill seeks to give president power over private (and public) networks
channel.description:
But the provision that is attracting the most attention is buried deep in the 51-page bill, in a section blandly titled "Cybersecurity Responsibility and Authority." It would give the president broad authority to directly intervene in security matters in both the public and private sectors. For starters, the bill would give the president the power to declare security emergencies and then curtail or shut down Internet traffic to and from any compromised federal or critical infrastructure networks.
Most important part ^ Source: http://www.infoworld.com/d/security-central/bill-seeks-give-president-power-over-private-networks-277?page=0,0 Discuss.

item.title: [US] Bill seeks to give president power over private (and public) networks
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

mwiebelhaus:

Seriously are these guys fucking stupid haven’t they heard of proxy?

What…? This is talking about blocking all incoming/outgoing connections to any network within US jurisdiction (if Obama uses it). That has absolutely nothing to do with a proxy.

Read full topic

item.source: [US] Bill seeks to give president power over private (and public) networks

item.title: [US] Bill seeks to give president power over private (and public) networks
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:23, topic:274620”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=362819.msg2760350#msg2760350 date=1240506615]

Internet should be free with no limits/government.
End of story.

Exactly, I think it could be argued as being in violation of the right of free speech, press and assembly. Probably more.
[/quote]

Though I think it’d be a great fight, I really don’t see how the constitution can apply to something like the internet. I can see it is applicable from a certain point of view, but I really don’t think it can be done. The constitution enforces rights of American citizens, so the part that they have been denied a right can be argued, but nothing more. The constitution does not cover the actual network of users in private or public networks. The constitution is much more applicable for private networks than public networks, imo.[/quote]
Governing the internet would be an act of extraterritoriality, which in turn will piss many off and would be unconstitutional (in America, duh).

Read full topic
item.source: [US] Bill seeks to give president power over private (and public) networks

item.title: [US] Bill seeks to give president power over private (and public) networks
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

What I’m more worried about is the Hague invasion act. Your beloved ex-president G.W. Bush came up with the great idea to attack the Netherlands when an American soldier is going to be trialled in the ICC.

Beloved? Lul, his approval ratings were like 18% iirc.

Anyway, my brother’s coworker/boss came up with a ‘theory’ about this whole bill: Say someone is organizing a public riot with a group of people. The president will be able to say ‘this group of people are a threat to national security’. [me=President Obama]shuts down the internet[/me] The bill is going to end up being used to protect ourselves from ourselves.

Read full topic

item.title: [US] Bill seeks to give president power over private (and public) networks
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“cooper, post:24, topic:274620”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=362819.msg2760350#msg2760350 date=1240506615]

Internet should be free with no limits/government.
End of story.

Exactly, I think it could be argued as being in violation of the right of free speech, press and assembly. Probably more.
[/quote]
That won’t stop them, though.[/quote]

If the bill is passed, the Supreme Court can always check whether it is constitutional. If it isn’t, then they kill it. However, if it is not killed and the bill is used, someone (likely many people) may feel violated. They will then sue the United States and surely one of the cases will make it to the Supreme Court. The SC can then decide what to do with it then.

Read full topic

item.title: [US] Bill seeks to give president power over private (and public) networks
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:17, topic:274620”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=362819.msg2759067#msg2759067 date=1240420493]
Internet should be free with no limits/government.
End of story.
[/quote]

Exactly, I think it could be argued as being in violation of the right of free speech, press and assembly. Probably more.[/quote]

Though I think it’d be a great fight, I really don’t see how the constitution can apply to something like the internet. I can see it is applicable from a certain point of view, but I really don’t think it can be done. The constitution enforces rights of American citizens, so the part that they have been denied a right can be argued, but nothing more. The constitution does not cover the actual network of users in private or public networks. The constitution is much more applicable for private networks than public networks, imo.

[quote=“cumescape, post:22, topic:274620”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=362819.msg2759323#msg2759323 date=1240433864]

It’s already being used… my internet was shutdown 2 times now downloading movies from torrents… when I called them and asked why my internet wasn’t working they replied stop downloading illegal files even though they gave me another chance. It’s not a ISP related problem as I have a pretty popular internet provider possibly the most advertised here in New York. (Optimum Online). Plus I got a letter sent to my house once for downloading photoshop another warning this was long ago though.

But thats how protected things are on the internet nothing is free it only seems like it… and you have full control to get anything free you want but in the end would you like to pay the price? thats how it works.

You having internet alone is not a network. A network is a collection of people. Giving the president the power to shutdown public and private networks would have devastating effects imo. Tbh, these politicians don’t understand the kinda damage they are going to do, because they really don’t understand the internet at all.
[/quote]Sure they do.[/quote]

So you think that they know that if the internet is shutdown for one minute, many businesses will fail for that date, destroying stocks, trusts in currencies, and trust in online business, yet they are still so excited for such a ‘great bill’?

Read full topic

Tbh, these politicians don’t understand the kinda damage they are going to do, because they really don’t understand the internet at all.[/quote]Sure they do.

item.title: [US] Bill seeks to give president power over private (and public) networks
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:9, topic:274620”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=362819.msg2757302#msg2757302 date=1240283111]

you cant shutdown the entire internet like that,

sure, you can shutdown dns servers and major isps…

No, but he can prevent incoming and outgoing connections to the US for starters. Think about what kind of damage that alone can do.
[/quote]This is happening all around the world. The internet was already doomed the day it was born.

Its not like Obama will shutdown the internet every day just for fun, and it will only affect sites that only have US servers and US users.
But agree,US, EU, lawyers and Sweden starts to destroy the free internett just because of Music industry and the things this bill is used for.[/quote]

Of course it won’t only affect US users. There are many file hosts which hold servers in the US, many companies that hold servers in the US, and many transactions (money, product orders, etc) done to the US everyday. If any major country leaves the Internet web for one hour, the entire world will feel it (especially the US).

Read full topic

No, but he can prevent incoming and outgoing connections to the US for starters. Think about what kind of damage that alone can do.

But agree,US, EU, lawyers and Sweden starts to destroy the free internett just because of Music industry and the things this bill is used for.
